title: Monstrous Menagerie
data: {{version030}} {{spell info}} '''Monstrous Menagerie''' is a level 7 [[Summonings|Summoning]] spell which summons an exotic, ranged creature. ==Useful Info== One beast is summoned. Possible summons include: *{{monsterlink|Manticore}} *{{monsterlink|Lindwurm}} *{{monsterlink|Sphinx}} Higher [[spell power]] increases a chance to summon a [[sphinx]], and boosts the strength of the creature. *Chance of a sphinx is equal to (1 - 61 / ) / 2.{{source ref|0.30.0|spl-summoning.cc|233}} Otherwise, there's an equal chance of a manticore or lindwurm. *Summoned monsters gain from 0 to 6 additional [[HD]] based on spell power. The summon gains ( - 50) / 25 HD, rounded in a weighted fashion.{{source ref|0.30.0|spl-summoning.cc|241}} Duration of the summons is around 36 turns; it does not depend on the spell power. There is a summon limit of 2; additional summons will cause the oldest to very quickly time out. ==Strategy== The most standard of the level 7 Summonings spells. All monsters from this spell can attack from range, a distinct advantage compared to the lower level summons. Having a summon cap of 2 is also nice. ==Monster Version== The monster version functions like the player version, except no HD bonus is given to the summoned creatures. {{monsters with spell}} ==History== *Prior to [[0.28]], Monstrous Menagerie had a summon cap of 4. *Prior to [[0.27]], Monstrous Menagerie could summon 1-3 harpies. *Prior to [[0.22]], for followers of [[Dithmenos]], lindwurms were replaced by manticores. *Prior to [[0.18]], Monstrous Menagerie was a level 6 spell. *Prior to [[0.17]], this spell was found in the [[Book of Beasts]] and [[Book of Summonings]], but not the [[Grand Grimoire]]. *Prior to [[0.16]], this spell had a summon cap of 5. *Monstrous Menagerie was added in [[0.14]]. ==References==
